{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3353881,"name":"Om Agarwal","username":"OmA","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/o/977dab/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T11:23:02.669Z","cooked":"

Hi All! Greetings from London

We‚Äôve been working over the past few days on our vision system. It currently consists of three cameras.

  1. A Laser Cam - A Telepohoto OV9281 (Camera 3 / Laser in code)
  2. A Front Cam - A OV2311 (Camera 1 in Code)
  3. A Back Cam - A OV2311 (Camera 2 in Code)

The laser cam and the back cam share a Orange Pi, the front cam has it‚Äôs own Orange Pi.

They are mounted as follows

image1200√ó1600 259 KB

(Left Camera is Telephoto, Right Camera is the regular)
(Ignore the loose cable, needed it for quick access)

We are running PhotonVision version v2024.2.5.

The code estimates the pose of each camera independently, and then uses a filter with calculated confidence values and odometry to estimate it‚Äôs final pose.

It was working fine over the course of the week, but yesterday we started having issues with the front cam, it was consistently ~30-50cm off on the camera specific pose estimate. Here‚Äôs an example:

image1600√ó1200 178 KB
Real Life Robot, Tags were measured using a laser measuring tool and are toleranced within 2mm. White lines near the black and white laptop are the wing note markers, are also measured and toleranced.

No subject screenshot Apr 6 (1)701√ó458 81.2 KB

No subject screenshot Apr 6991√ó475 87.4 KB

These are the poses estimated by the two cameras. We are using PhotonPoseEstimator to generate these poses. These poses are being published here in our code to advantage kit.

The laser cam pose is close to perfect (yellow), but the front cam is clearly off (green).

We first took a look at our cameras. We recalibrated our camera, cleaned it, and refocused the lens, it did not help with the issue. We then took a look at the photon vision dashboard to find out more.

No subject screenshot Apr 6 (4)1916√ó1037 346 KB

No subject screenshot Apr 6 (3)1879√ó1048 169 KB

These are screenshots I took of the two forward facing cameras. (Top = Regular, Bottom = Laser). The estimated X distance both tags is the same for both cameras. I also checked using a laser measuring tool and got the same value (around 4m).

Our error looked similar to this post PhotonVision pose estimator no longer accurate after angling cameras, so we checked the code, but we couldn‚Äôt figure out what. We define the offsets in this file, and since both cameras are next to each other the offsets are near identical.

We‚Äôre a bit lost on what‚Äôs going on. I also checked the tags in PhotonVision the values for ID 7 and they line up. I also checked the distance to best target in advantage scope and it also was 4m for both laser and regular cam.

This issue also occurs at closer distances, but the laser cam can‚Äôt see that close, so this distance was the best for debugging. For example, when we were up against the subwoofer, the robot was halfway into the subwoofer.

So we aren‚Äôt quite sure what is causing the discrepancy between the distance measured in PhotonVision and our estimated pose, but all these values are coming straight from the PhotonPoseEstimator class, so we aren‚Äôt quite sure what‚Äôs happening. In addition, the vision system was working fine the previous day, and no changes were made before this issue started occurring.

Here are some more screenshots:

No subject screenshot Apr 6 (9)1517√ó942 116 KB

No subject screenshot Apr 6 (8)1258√ó1001 61.4 KB

I‚Äôm happy to provide any other screenshots. The full code base is here: GitHub - FRC1884/season2024 at testing-1884.

Director","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3353885,"name":"Matt","username":"thatmattguy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thatmattguy/{size}/222358_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T11:49:32.774Z","cooked":"

Hello! Having two cameras side by side is actually pretty great for eliminating confounding factors. I‚Äôm really thrown by the fact that you said your accuracy just decided to change one day though lol. A couple of ideas

  • turn on ‚ÄúAlways Do Single-Target Estimation‚Äù under output. This will calculate your camera to individual target pose using solvePNP, instead of based on the field to robot multi-tag pose
  • similar to the above, what happens to the pose if you can only see one tag?
  • is it at all possible that the field changed shape or was bumped?
  • are you graphing your estimated 2d or 3d pose in advantage scope? If 2d, how does 3d look? There‚Äôs some extra info we might be able to gain
  • I know you said it was working and then it wasn‚Äôt, so for that reason I‚Äôm hesitant to blame camera calibration.

Hi thanks for the response,

  1. We‚Äôve tried hiding a tag, and the pose is still inaccurate for the front cam
  2. The field was redone for the purposes of attempting to fix this issue, it‚Äôs present on our setup on the red alliance too. I also assume that this issue would be present for the other camera too if it was the field
  3. We‚Äôre graphing 2D pose, I can take a look at 3D pose soon, that might be interesting

Is it concerning that both cameras have different field-to-camera values for the multi-tag? Also, is there a reason not to use multitag pose estimation?

Thanks for the help! We‚Äôll try plotting the 3D values for the time being

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":4,"updated_at":"2024-04-07T12:08:00.893Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":111,"readers_count":110,"score":22.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":461535,"topic_slug":"photon-vision-estimating-pose-incorrectly","display_username":"Om Agarwal","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":37738,"username":"thatmattguy","name":"Matt","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thatmattguy/{size}/222358_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":51761,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"üá¨üáß 1797 | Technical Director"},"post_url":"/t/photon-vision-estimating-pose-incorrectly/461535/3","custom_user_title":"üá¨üáß 1797 | Technical Director","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3353898,"name":"Matt","username":"thatmattguy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/thatmattguy/{size}/222358_2.png","created_at":"2024-04-07T12:15:54.104Z","cooked":"

If you can only see one tag, photon should fall back to doing regular pose estimation (just camera->tag, and no multitag). So if you‚Äôre still seeing big differences in 3D pose with just one tag visible, that to me would indicate calibration differences. Does the amount of discrepancy change as the right yaws in place, and how does it change with distance to the tag?
